values.description: Restrict access to space segment and ground segment systems through authentication and authorization controls.
Require multi-factor authentication for operational control systems, mission management interfaces, and remote access points.
Protect TT&C, payload, and inter-satellite communications with strong cryptographic protocols to reduce risk of interception and injection.
Authenticate uplink signals to prevent spoofing and unauthorized command injection.
Establish secure key management processes for TT&C and payload encryption, including key rotation and compromise response.
Verify software integrity using code signing, checksums, and secure boot processes to prevent execution of malicious or altered software.
Isolate mission-critical systems, including TT&C, from enterprise networks or public interfaces to limit lateral movement.
Detect and respond to RF or optical jamming attempts using monitoring and signal integrity checks.
Implement redundancy and failover mechanisms at the spacecraft and ground station level to maintain mission capability under attack.
Deploy anomaly detection systems to identify suspicious telemetry patterns, uplink anomalies, or unexpected system behavior.
Enforce supply chain security practices for spacecraft components, ensuring traceability, verification, and tamper resistance.
Develop and test incident response playbooks specific to space operations, including contingency uplink, safe-mode, and key rotation procedures.
